Move.Name: Act With Confidence
Move.Description: When you attempt to act with confidence, roll confidence

CriticalFailure.Description: Not only does the actor fail to impress the target of their point of view, but the target thinks they are a phony. The actor has -1D6 to any attempts to convince or manipulate the target of anything until they end of the episode

Failure.Description: The actor totally fails to impress the tagret. Mark an exp on Skills

PartialSuccess.Description: The actor has a limited success. The target is swayed by the actor's confidence and the actor the actor takes +1D6 to their next attempt to manipulate or convince the target. However the target may chose one of the following:

Options.Option: Still uncertain. The actor must add to their argument but take +1D6 to all further attempts to convince the target of this one thing.
The target thinks the actor is fill of themselves. The actor's +1D6 is nullified and the target takes 2 points of stress from social consequences.
The target will go along with the target, but they expect a favor down the line. The target gets 1 bond with you

FullSuccess.Description: The actor impresses the target with their confidence. The actor takes +1D6 to their next attempt to manipulate or convince the target.

CriticalSuccess.Description: The target accepts the actor as a leader. The actor takes +1D6 to their next attempt to manipulate or convince the target and gains 1 bond with the target.

Move.Name: Avoid Harm
Move.Description: *When you try to avoid physical harm, you roll athletics*

Failure.Description: Actor takes a medium harm. Mark an exp on Talents

PartialSuccess.Description: Actor takes a light harm. Target may also choose one of the following:

Options.Option: Reposition. Actor takes -1D6 to their next Harm or Avoid Harm roll
Weak counter, target takes a light harm

CriticalSuccess.Description: Defense and reposte. Actor takes no harm. target takes a medium harm.

Move.Name: Convince
Move.Description: When you attempt to convince someone, roll manipulation.

CriticalFailure.Description: Not only does the actor fail to convince the target of their point of view, but the targets are now skeptical of anything they say. The actor has -1D6 to any attempts to convince them of anything until they end of the episode

Failure.Description: The actor totally fails to convince the tagret. Mark an exp on Skills

PartialSuccess.Description: The actor has a limited success. The target is swayed by the actor's words but can chose one of the following:

Options.Option: Still uncertain. The actor must add to their argument but take +1D6 to all further attempts to convince the target of this one thing.
The target rejects the actor's argument argument and take 2 points of stress from cognitive dissonance.
The target will do or believe as you suggest, but expect a favor down the line. The target gets 1 bond with you

FullSuccess.Description: The target totally buys the actor's argument and should act accordingly.

CriticalSuccess.Description: Not only does the target buy the actor's argument, but they look to you for leadership. Take +1 bond with them.

Move.Name: Difficult Communication
Move.Description: *When you try to communicate under difficult circumstances, roll communication.*

CriticalFailure.Description: Not only does the actor fail to communicate but the target gets an incorrect, or even insulting, impression of what the actor ius trying to communicate. The actor loses one bond with the target. If the actor has bonds with the target, they lose one bond with anyone the target chooses who the target has a bond with.

Failure.Description: The actor totally fails to communicate. Mark an exp on Skills

PartialSuccess.Description: The actor has limited success. Choose 6 words to communicate what you are trying to say.

FullSuccess.Description: The actor can talk in the clear with the other person. They can ask you questions and you can answer them.

CriticalSuccess.Description: Not only the actor talk in the clear like in Full Success but the target also takes +1D6 forward on their next action they take based on your information.

CriticalFailure.Description: Not only does the actor fail to communicate but the target gets an incorrect, or even insulting, impression of what you are trying to communicate. Failure.Description: The actor totally fails to communicate. Mark an exp on Talents

CriticalSuccess.Description: Not only does the actor take +1D6 forward on their next attempt to impress, communicate or manipulate the target, but they also take one bond with the target.

Move.Name: Figure Something Out
Move.Description: *When you try to figure something out you roll** ***brains*****.*

CriticalFailure.Description: The actor is completely flummoxed. The actor takes -1D6 to any further attempts to figure this out.

Failure.Description: The actor learns nothing. Mark an exp on Talents

FullSuccess.Description: The actor may ask any questions they like about the situation

CriticalSuccess.Description: In addition to a full success, the actor takes +1d6 forward to your next action that uses the information discovered.
